alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Van Buren; White (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 6:11PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Cumberland, central Van Buren and southeastern White Counties through 645 PM CDT... At 610 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles south of Monterey to 8 miles south of Spencer. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Crossville, Spencer, Pleasant Hill, Fall Creek Falls State Park, Indian Rock Lake, Virgin Falls State Natural Area and Lake Tansi. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 309 and 320. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
